+ impl GitVisualizer3D {
+     /// Timeline control initialization
+     fn init_timeline(&amp;self) -&gt; TimelineControl {
+         let timestamps: Vec&lt;i64&gt; = self.commits.iter()
+             .map(|c| c.timestamp)
+             .collect();
+         
+         let start_time = *timestamps.iter().min().unwrap_or(&amp;0);
+         let end_time = *timestamps.iter().max().unwrap_or(&amp;0);
+         
+         TimelineControl {
+             start_time,
+             end_time,
+             current_time: end_time, // Start from latest
+             speed: 1.0,
+             window_size: 86400 * 30, // 30 days window
+         }
+     }
+     
+     /// Filter commits by time window
+     fn filter_by_time(&amp;self, time: i64, window: i64) -&gt; Vec&lt;&amp;CommitNode3D&gt; {
+         self.commits.iter()
+             .filter(|c| c.timestamp &gt;= time - window &amp;&amp; c.timestamp &lt;= time)
+             .collect()
+     }
+     
+     /// Render time axis (4th dimension)
+     fn render_time_axis(&amp;self, frame: &amp;mut Frame, area: Rect) {
+         let timeline = format!(
+             &quot;Timeline: {} â†’ {} (Current: {})&quot;,
+             timestamp_to_string(self.time_control.start_time),
+             timestamp_to_string(self.time_control.end_time),
+             timestamp_to_string(self.time_control.current_time)
+         );
+         
+         let paragraph = Paragraph::new(timeline)
+             .style(Style::default().fg(Color::Cyan))
+             .block(Block::default().borders(Borders::ALL).title(&quot;Time Axis&quot;));
+         
+         frame.render_widget(paragraph, area);
+     }
+     
+     /// Calculate heat level (commit frequency)
+     fn calculate_heat(&amp;self, commit: &amp;CommitNode3D) -&gt; f32 {
+         let window = 86400 * 7; // 7 days
+         let nearby_commits = self.commits.iter()
+             .filter(|c| (c.timestamp - commit.timestamp).abs() &lt; window)
+             .count();
+         
+         (nearby_commits as f32 / 100.0).min(1.0) // Normalize to 0-1
+     }
+     
+     /// Playback control (time animation)
+     pub fn tick_playback(&amp;mut self, delta_time: f32) {
+         if !self.playback_active {
+             return;
+         }
+         
+         let time_delta = (delta_time * self.playback_speed * 86400.0) as i64; // days
+         self.current_time += time_delta;
+         
+         if self.current_time &gt; self.time_control.end_time {
+             self.current_time = self.time_control.start_time; // Loop
+         }
+         
+         self.time_control.current_time = self.current_time;
+     }
+     
+     /// Render with time filtering (4D visualization)
+     pub fn render_4d(&amp;mut self, frame: &amp;mut Frame, area: Rect) {
+         // Filter commits by current time window
+         let visible_commits = self.filter_by_time(
+             self.current_time,
+             self.time_control.window_size
+         );
+         
+         // Render 3D graph with time-filtered commits
+         self.render_3d_filtered(frame, area, &amp;visible_commits);
+         
+         // Render time axis
+         let time_area = Rect::new(area.x, area.y + area.height - 3, area.width, 3);
+         self.render_time_axis(frame, time_area);
+     }
+ }

+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { Canvas, useFrame } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import { OrbitControls, Text, Line } from &#39;@react-three/drei&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ 
+ interface Commit4D {
+   pos: [number, number, number]
+   hash: string
+   message: string
+   timestamp: number
+   heat: number
+   changes: number
+ }
+ 
+ function CommitNode({ commit, visible }: { commit: Commit4D; visible: boolean }) {
+   const meshRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Mesh&gt;(null)
+   
+   useFrame(() =&gt; {
+     if (meshRef.current) {
+       meshRef.current.rotation.y += 0.01
+     }
+   })
+   
+   const color = new THREE.Color().setHSL(commit.heat, 0.8, 0.5)
+   const size = Math.log(commit.changes + 1) * 0.5
+   
+   if (!visible) return null
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;mesh ref={meshRef} position={commit.pos}&gt;
+       &lt;sphereGeometry args={[size, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+       &lt;meshStandardMaterial color={color} /&gt;
+       &lt;Text
+         position={[0, size + 0.5, 0]}
+         fontSize={0.3}
+         color=&quot;white&quot;
+       &gt;
+         {commit.hash.substring(0, 7)}
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     &lt;/mesh&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ function TimeAxis({ startTime, endTime, currentTime }: { 
+   startTime: number
+   endTime: number
+   currentTime: number 
+ }) {
+   const progress = (currentTime - startTime) / (endTime - startTime)
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;group&gt;
+       &lt;Line
+         points={[[-50, -20, 0], [50, -20, 0]]}
+         color=&quot;cyan&quot;
+         lineWidth={2}
+       /&gt;
+       &lt;mesh position={[-50 + progress * 100, -20, 0]}&gt;
+         &lt;sphereGeometry args={[0.5, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+         &lt;meshStandardMaterial color=&quot;yellow&quot; /&gt;
+       &lt;/mesh&gt;
+       &lt;Text
+         position={[-50 + progress * 100, -22, 0]}
+         fontSize={0.5}
+         color=&quot;white&quot;
+       &gt;
+         {new Date(currentTime * 1000).toLocaleDateString()}
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     &lt;/group&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ export default function GitVisualization3D() {
+   const [commits, setCommits] = useState&lt;Commit4D[]&gt;([])
+   const [currentTime, setCurrentTime] = useState(Date.now() / 1000)
+   const [playing, setPlaying] = useState(false)
+   const [speed, setSpeed] = useState(1.0)
+   const [windowSize, setWindowSize] = useState(86400 * 30) // 30 days
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     // Load commits from Rust backend
+     loadCommitsFromRust()
+   }, [])
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     if (!playing) return
+     
+     const interval = setInterval(() =&gt; {
+       setCurrentTime(t =&gt; {
+         const newTime = t + speed * 86400 // 1 day per tick
+         const maxTime = Math.max(...commits.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp))
+         return newTime &gt; maxTime ? Math.min(...commits.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp)) : newTime
+       })
+     }, 100)
+     
+     return () =&gt; clearInterval(interval)
+   }, [playing, speed, commits])
+   
+   const visibleCommits = commits.filter(c =&gt; 
+     c.timestamp &gt;= currentTime - windowSize &amp;&amp; c.timestamp &lt;= currentTime
+   )
+   
+   const startTime = commits.length &gt; 0 ? Math.min(...commits.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp)) : 0
+   const endTime = commits.length &gt; 0 ? Math.max(...commits.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp)) : 0
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;div style={{ width: &#39;100vw&#39;, height: &#39;100vh&#39; }}&gt;
+       &lt;Canvas camera={{ position: [0, 0, 100], fov: 60 }}&gt;
+         &lt;ambientLight intensity={0.5} /&gt;
+         &lt;pointLight position={[10, 10, 10]} /&gt;
+         &lt;OrbitControls /&gt;
+         
+         {visibleCommits.map(commit =&gt; (
+           &lt;CommitNode key={commit.hash} commit={commit} visible={true} /&gt;
+         ))}
+         
+         &lt;TimeAxis startTime={startTime} endTime={endTime} currentTime={currentTime} /&gt;
+       &lt;/Canvas&gt;
+       
+       &lt;div style={{ position: &#39;absolute&#39;, bottom: 20, left: 20, color: &#39;white&#39; }}&gt;
+         &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; setPlaying(!playing)}&gt;
+           {playing ? &#39;â¸ Pause&#39; : &#39;â–¶ Play&#39;}
+         &lt;/button&gt;
+         &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; setSpeed(speed * 2)}&gt;â© Speed x{speed}&lt;/button&gt;
+         &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; setSpeed(Math.max(0.25, speed / 2))}&gt;âª Slow&lt;/button&gt;
+         &lt;div&gt;
+           Visible: {visibleCommits.length} / {commits.length} commits
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+         &lt;div&gt;
+           Time: {new Date(currentTime * 1000).toLocaleString()}
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+   
+   async function loadCommitsFromRust() {
+     try {
+       const { invoke } = await import(&#39;@tauri-apps/api/tauri&#39;)
+       const data = await invoke&lt;Commit4D[]&gt;(&#39;get_git_commits_4d&#39;)
+       setCommits(data)
+       if (data.length &gt; 0) {
+         setCurrentTime(Math.max(...data.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp)))
+       }
+     } catch (err) {
+       console.error(&#39;Failed to load commits:&#39;, err)
+     }
+   }
+ }

+ #[tauri::command]
+ pub async fn get_git_commits_4d() -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;Commit4D&gt;, String&gt; {
+     use git2::Repository;
+     
+     let repo = Repository::open(&quot;.&quot;)
+         .map_err(|e| format!(&quot;Failed to open repo: {}&quot;, e))?;
+     
+     let mut revwalk = repo.revwalk()
+         .map_err(|e| format!(&quot;Failed to create revwalk: {}&quot;, e))?;
+     
+     revwalk.push_head()
+         .map_err(|e| format!(&quot;Failed to push head: {}&quot;, e))?;
+     
+     let commits: Vec&lt;Commit4D&gt; = revwalk
+         .take(10000)
+         .filter_map(|oid| {
+             let oid = oid.ok()?;
+             let commit = repo.find_commit(oid).ok()?;
+             
+             Some(Commit4D {
+                 pos: calculate_3d_position(&amp;commit),
+                 hash: format!(&quot;{}&quot;, oid),
+                 message: commit.message().unwrap_or(&quot;&quot;).to_string(),
+                 timestamp: commit.time().seconds(),
+                 heat: 0.5, // TODO: Calculate
+                 changes: commit.tree().ok()?.len(),
+             })
+         })
+         .collect();
+     
+     Ok(commits)
+ }

Result&lt;SandboxInstance&gt; {\n        // WSL2 ã‚«ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ ãƒ‡ã‚£ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ä½œæˆ\n        let distro_name = format!(\&quot;Codex-WSL-{}\&quot;, uuid::Uuid::new_v4());\n        \n        // Ubuntu Baseã‚’ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆ\n        let output = std::process::Command::new(\&quot;wsl\&quot;)\n            .args(&amp;[\&quot;--import\&quot;, &amp;distro_name, &amp;format!(\&quot;C:\\\\WSL\\\\{}\&quot;, distro_name), \&quot;ubuntu-base.tar.gz\&quot;])\n            .output()?;\n        \n        if !output.status.success() {\n            return Err(anyhow::anyhow!(\&quot;Failed to create WSL2 distro\&quot;));\n        }\n        \n        // Codexã‚’ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«\n        std::process::Command::new(\&quot;wsl\&quot;)\n            .args(&amp;[\&quot;-d\&quot;, &amp;distro_name, \&quot;-e\&quot;, \&quot;bash\&quot;, \&quot;-c\&quot;, \&quot;curl -fsSL https://install.codex.sh | sh\&quot;])\n            .output()?;\n        \n        Ok(SandboxInstance {\n            id: distro_name,\n            sandbox_type: SandboxType::Wsl2,\n        })\n    }\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### 5.3 MCPçµŒç”±ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹åˆ¶å¾¡\n\n**ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«**: &#96;codex-rs/mcp-server/src/tools/sandbox_tools.rs&#96;\n\nMCPãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã¨ã—ã¦å…¬é–‹ï¼š\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;rust\npub struct SandboxTools {\n    manager: Arc&lt;SandboxManager&gt;,\n}\n\nimpl SandboxTools {\n    pub fn register_tools(&amp;self) -&gt; },\n                        \&quot;enable_gpu\&quot;: { \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;boolean\&quot;, \&quot;default\&quot;: true },\n                        \&quot;enable_network\&quot;: { \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;boolean\&quot;, \&quot;default\&quot;: true }\n                    }\n                }),\n            },\n            Tool {\n                name: \&quot;execute_in_sandbox\&quot;.to_string(),\n                description: \&quot;Execute command in sandbox OS\&quot;.to_string(),\n                input_schema: json!({\n                    \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;object\&quot;,\n                    \&quot;properties\&quot;: {\n                        \&quot;sandbox_id\&quot;: { \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;string\&quot; Err(anyhow::anyhow!(\&quot;Unknown tool: {}\&quot;, tool_name))\n        }\n    }\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### 5.4 CLIã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰è¿½åŠ \n\n**ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«**: &#96;codex-rs/cli/src/main.rs&#96;\n\næ–°è¦ã‚µãƒ–ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ï¼š\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;rust\n#[derive(Parser, Debug)]\nenum Subcommand {\n    // ... æ—¢å­˜ã®ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰\n    \n    /// Manage sandbox OS environments\n    Sandbox {\n        #[command(subcommand)]\n        command: SandboxCommand,\n    },\n}\n\n#[derive(Parser, Debug)]\nenum SandboxCommand {\n    /// Create new sandbox OS\n    Create {\n        /// Sandbox type: windows_sandbox, hyperv, wsl2, appcontainer\n        #[arg(long, default_value = \&quot;windows_sandbox\&quot;)]\n        sandbox_type: String,\n        \n        /// Workspace path to mount\n        #[arg(long)]\n        workspace: PathBuf,\n    },\n    \n    /// List active sandboxes\n    List,\n    \n    /// Execute command in sandbox\n    Exec {\n        /// Sandbox ID\n        sandbox_id: String,\n        \n        /// Command to execute\n        command: String,\n    },\n    \n    /// Destroy sandbox\n    Destroy {\n        /// Sandbox ID\n        sandbox_id: String,\n    },\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### 5.5 ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹å†…GUIãƒ»ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ç’°å¢ƒ\n\n**æ–°è¦ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒª**: &#96;codex-rs/sandbox-os-gui/&#96;\n\nLinux/macOSé¢¨ã®è¦‹ãŸç›®ã¨å®Ÿè£…ã‚’æŒã¤ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹å°‚ç”¨GUIï¼š\n\n#### 5.5.1 ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹å°‚ç”¨ã‚·ã‚§ãƒ«\n\n**ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«**: &#96;codex-rs/sandbox-os-gui/src/sandbox_shell.rs&#96;\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;rust\npub struct SandboxShell {\n    environment: HashMap&lt;String, String&gt;,\n    working_dir: PathBuf,\n    command_history: Vec&lt;String&gt;,\n    isolation_mode: IsolationMode,\n}\n\npub enum IsolationMode {\n    FullIsolation,      // å®Œå…¨é®æ–­ï¼ˆãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ»ãƒ›ã‚¹ãƒˆé€šä¿¡ãªã—ï¼‰\n    RestrictedAccess,   // åˆ¶é™ä»˜ããƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å…±æœ‰ã®ã¿\n}\n\nimpl SandboxShell {\n    pub fn new(isolation_mode: IsolationMode) -&gt; Self {\n        let mut env = HashMap::new();\n        env.insert(\&quot;HOME\&quot;.to_string(), \&quot;/home/sandbox\&quot;.to_string());\n        env.insert(\&quot;USER\&quot;.to_string(), \&quot;sandbox\&quot;.to_string());\n        env.insert(\&quot;SHELL\&quot;.to_string(), \&quot;/bin/codex-shell\&quot;.to_string());\n        env.insert(\&quot;PATH\&quot;.to_string(), \&quot;/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin\&quot;.to_string());\n        \n        Self {\n            environment: env,\n            working_dir: PathBuf::from(\&quot;/home/sandbox\&quot;),\n            command_history: vec![],\n            isolation_mode,\n        }\n    }\n    \n    pub async fn execute_command(&amp;mut self, cmd: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;CommandOutput&gt; {\n        self.command_history.push(cmd.to_string());\n        \n        // ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚’å®Œå…¨é®æ–­\n        if self.isolation_mode == IsolationMode::FullIsolation {\n            if cmd.contains(\&quot;curl\&quot;) || cmd.contains(\&quot;wget\&quot;) || cmd.contains(\&quot;ping\&quot;) {\n                return Err(anyhow::anyhow!(\&quot;Network access denied in full isolation mode\&quot;));\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹å†…å°‚ç”¨ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰å®Ÿè£…\n        let parts: Vec&lt;&amp;str&gt; self.cmd_pwd(),\n            Some(&amp;\&quot;cat\&quot;) =&gt; self.cmd_cat(parts.get(1)),\n            Some(&amp;\&quot;echo\&quot;) =&gt; self.cmd_echo(&amp;parts[1..]),\n            Some(&amp;\&quot;mkdir\&quot;) =&gt; + impl TimelineControl {
+     /// Create new timeline control from commit range
+     pub fn new(start_time: i64, end_time: i64) -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             start_time,
+             end_time,
+             current_time: end_time, // Start at latest
+             speed: 1.0,
+             window_size: 86400 * 30, // 30 days window by default
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Advance timeline by delta seconds
+     pub fn advance(&amp;mut self, delta: f32) {
+         let delta_time = (delta * self.speed) as i64;
+         self.current_time = (self.current_time - delta_time).clamp(self.start_time, self.end_time);
+     }
+ 
+     /// Set timeline position (0.0-1.0, where 0.0 is start, 1.0 is end)
+     pub fn set_position(&amp;mut self, position: f32) {
+         let pos = position.clamp(0.0, 1.0);
+         let time_range = self.end_time - self.start_time;
+         self.current_time = self.start_time + ((time_range as f32 * pos) as i64);
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get visible commits within current time window
+     pub fn get_visible_commits&lt;&#39;a&gt;(&amp;self, all_commits: &amp;&#39;a [CommitNode3D]) -&gt; Vec&lt;&amp;&#39;a CommitNode3D&gt; {
+         let window_start = self.current_time - self.window_size;
+         let window_end = self.current_time;
+ 
+         all_commits
+             .iter()
+             .filter(|commit| {
+                 commit.timestamp &gt;= window_start &amp;&amp; commit.timestamp &lt;= window_end
+             })
+             .collect()
+     }
+ 
+     /// Adjust playback speed
+     pub fn adjust_speed(&amp;mut self, delta: f32) {
+         self.speed = (self.speed + delta).clamp(0.1, 100.0);
+     }

+     /// Get progress as 0.0-1.0
+     pub fn get_progress(&amp;self) -&gt; f32 {
+         if self.end_time == self.start_time {
+             return 1.0;
+         }
+         let elapsed = self.current_time - self.start_time;
+         let total = self.end_time - self.start_time;
+         (elapsed as f32) / (total as f32)
+     }
+ }

+     fn calculate_heat(timestamp: i64, index: usize, total: usize) -&gt; f32 {
+         // Recent commits are &quot;hotter&quot;
+         let recency_factor = 1.0 - (index as f32 / total as f32);

+ //! Ollama inference engine implementation
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use codex_ollama::{GenerateRequest, OllamaClient};
+ use serde_json::json;
+ use tokio_stream::Stream;
+ 
+ /// Ollama inference engine
+ pub struct OllamaInferenceEngine {
+     client: OllamaClient,
+     model: String,
+     max_tokens: usize,
+ }
+ 
+ impl OllamaInferenceEngine {
+     /// Create new Ollama engine
+     pub fn new(base_url: Option&lt;String&gt;, model: String) -&gt; Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         let url = base_url.unwrap_or_else(|| &quot;http://localhost:11434&quot;.to_string());
+         let client = OllamaClient::new(&amp;url).context(&quot;Failed to create Ollama client&quot;)?;
+ 
+         Ok(Self {
+             client,
+             model,
+             max_tokens: 4096,
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Perform inference (non-streaming)
+     pub async fn infer(&amp;self, prompt: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+         let request = GenerateRequest {
+             model: self.model.clone(),
+             prompt: prompt.to_string(),
+             options: Some(json!({
+                 &quot;num_predict&quot;: self.max_tokens,
+                 &quot;temperature&quot;: 0.7,
+             })),
+             stream: Some(false),
+             ..Default::default()
+         };
+ 
+         let response = self
+             .client
+             .generate(request)
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Ollama inference failed&quot;)?;
+ 
+         Ok(response.response)
+     }
+ 
+     /// List available models
+     pub async fn list_models(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;String&gt;&gt; {
+         let models = self
+             .client
+             .list_models()
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Failed to list Ollama models&quot;)?;
+ 
+         Ok(models.into_iter().map(|m| m.name).collect())
+     }
+ 
+     /// Stream inference (for real-time output)
+     pub async fn stream_infer(&amp;self, prompt: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;impl Stream&lt;Item = Result&lt;String&gt;&gt;&gt; {
+         let request = GenerateRequest {
+             model: self.model.clone(),
+             prompt: prompt.to_string(),
+             stream: Some(true),
+             ..Default::default()
+         };
+ 
+         self.client
+             .generate_stream(request)
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Failed to start streaming inference&quot;)
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod tests {
+     use super::*;
+ 
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn test_ollama_inference() {
+         // Skip if Ollama server not running
+         let engine = match OllamaInferenceEngine::new(None, &quot;gpt-oss:20b&quot;.to_string()) {
+             Ok(e) =&gt; e,
+             Err(_) =&gt; return, // Skip test if Ollama unavailable
+         };
+ 
+         let output = engine.infer(&quot;Hello, world!&quot;).await;
+         if let Ok(text) = output {
+             assert!(!text.is_empty());
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn test_list_models() {
+         let engine = match OllamaInferenceEngine::new(None, &quot;gpt-oss:20b&quot;.to_string()) {
+             Ok(e) =&gt; e,
+             Err(_) =&gt; return,
+         };
+ 
+         let models = engine.list_models().await;
+         if let Ok(list) = models {
+             assert!(!list.is_empty());
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
```

+     /// Register Codex as Windows 11 MCP system agent
+     pub async fn register_as_system_agent(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         // Windows Registry registration
+         self.register_to_registry()?;
+ 
+         // Start MCP listener
+         self.start_system_listener().await?;
+

+         Ok(())

+         use winreg::RegKey;
+ 
+         let hklm = RegKey::predef(HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE);
+         let (key, _) = hklm
+             .create_subkey(&quot;SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\AI\\Agents\\Codex&quot;)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to create registry key&quot;)?;
+ 
+         key.set_value(&quot;DisplayName&quot;, &amp;&quot;Codex AI Agent&quot;)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to set DisplayName&quot;)?;
+         key.set_value(
+             &quot;Executable&quot;,
+             &amp;std::env::current_exe()?
+                 .to_string_lossy()
+                 .to_string(),
+         )
+         .context(&quot;Failed to set Executable&quot;)?;
+         key.set_value(&quot;Protocol&quot;, &amp;&quot;MCP&quot;)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to set Protocol&quot;)?;
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }

+     }

+     // Check if running as administrator
+     use std::ptr;
+     use winapi::um::securitybaseapi::GetTokenInformation;
+     use winapi::um::winnt::{TokenElevation, TOKEN_ELEVATION, TOKEN_QUERY};
+ 
+     unsafe {
+         let mut token: winapi::um::winnt::HANDLE = ptr::null_mut();
+         let current_process = winapi::um::processthreadsapi::GetCurrentProcess();
+ 
+         if winapi::um::processthreadsapi::OpenProcessToken(
+             current_process,
+             TOKEN_QUERY,
+             &amp;mut token,
+         ) == 0
+         {
+             return false;
+         }
+ 
+         let mut elevation = TOKEN_ELEVATION { TokenIsElevated: 0 };
+         let mut size = 0u32;
+ 
+         if GetTokenInformation(
+             token,
+             TokenElevation,
+             &amp;mut elevation as *mut _ as *mut _,
+             std::mem::size_of::&lt;TOKEN_ELEVATION&gt;() as u32,
+             &amp;mut size,
+         ) == 0
+         {
+             winapi::um::handleapi::CloseHandle(token);
+             return false;
+         }
+ 
+         winapi::um::handleapi::CloseHandle(token);
+         elevation.TokenIsElevated != 0
+     }
+ }

+ //! Sandbox OS manager for Windows/Hyper-V/WSL2/AppContainer
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use std::path::PathBuf;
+ use uuid::Uuid;
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy)]
+ pub enum SandboxType {
+     WindowsSandbox,
+     HyperV,
+     Wsl2,
+     AppContainer,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug)]
+ pub struct SandboxConfig {
+     pub workspace_path: PathBuf,
+     pub enable_network: bool,
+     pub memory_mb: usize,
+     pub cpu_count: usize,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug)]
+ pub struct SandboxInstance {
+     pub id: String,
+     pub sandbox_type: SandboxType,
+ }
+ 
+ pub struct SandboxManager {
+     sandbox_type: SandboxType,
+ }
+ 
+ impl SandboxManager {
+     pub fn new(sandbox_type: SandboxType) -&gt; Self {
+         Self { sandbox_type }
+     }
+ 
+     pub async fn create_sandbox_os(&amp;self, config: SandboxConfig) -&gt; Result&lt;SandboxInstance&gt; {
+         match self.sandbox_type {
+             SandboxType::WindowsSandbox =&gt; self.create_windows_sandbox(config).await,
+             SandboxType::HyperV =&gt; self.create_hyperv_vm(config).await,
+             SandboxType::Wsl2 =&gt; self.create_wsl2_distro(config).await,
+             SandboxType::AppContainer =&gt; self.create_appcontainer(config).await,
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     async fn create_windows_sandbox(&amp;self, config: SandboxConfig) -&gt; Result&lt;SandboxInstance&gt; {
+         let network = if config.enable_network {
+             &quot;Enable&quot;
+         } else {
+             &quot;Disable&quot;
+         };
+ 
+         let wsb_content = format!(
+             r#&quot;&lt;Configuration&gt;
+   &lt;VGpu&gt;Enable&lt;/VGpu&gt;
+   &lt;Networking&gt;{network}&lt;/Networking&gt;
+   &lt;MemoryInMB&gt;{}&lt;/MemoryInMB&gt;
+   &lt;MappedFolders&gt;
+     &lt;MappedFolder&gt;
+       &lt;HostFolder&gt;{}&lt;/HostFolder&gt;
+       &lt;ReadOnly&gt;false&lt;/ReadOnly&gt;
+     &lt;/MappedFolder&gt;
+   &lt;/MappedFolders&gt;
+ &lt;/Configuration&gt;&quot;#,
+             config.memory_mb,
+             config.workspace_path.display()
+         );
+ 
+         let sandbox_id = Uuid::new_v4().to_string();
+         let wsb_path =
+             std::env::temp_dir().join(format!(&quot;codex-sandbox-{sandbox_id}.wsb&quot;));
+ 
+         std::fs::write(&amp;wsb_path, wsb_content).context(&quot;Failed to write WSB configuration file&quot;)?;
+ 
+         std::process::Command::new(&quot;WindowsSandbox.exe&quot;)
+             .arg(&amp;wsb_path)
+             .spawn()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to launch Windows Sandbox&quot;)?;
+ 
+         tracing::info!(&quot;Created Windows Sandbox: {sandbox_id}&quot;);
+ 
+         Ok(SandboxInstance {
+             id: sandbox_id,
+             sandbox_type: SandboxType::WindowsSandbox,
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     async fn create_hyperv_vm(&amp;self, _config: SandboxConfig) -&gt; Result&lt;SandboxInstance&gt; {
+         anyhow::bail!(&quot;Hyper-V support not yet implemented&quot;)
+     }
+ 
+     async fn create_wsl2_distro(&amp;self, _config: SandboxConfig) -&gt; Result&lt;SandboxInstance&gt; {
+         anyhow::bail!(&quot;WSL2 support not yet implemented&quot;)
+     }
+ 
+     async fn create_appcontainer(&amp;self, _config: SandboxConfig) -&gt; Result&lt;SandboxInstance&gt; {
+         anyhow::bail!(&quot;AppContainer support not yet implemented&quot;)
+     }
+ }
+

+ //! Complete network isolation for sandboxes
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use std::process::Command;
+ 
+ pub struct NetworkIsolation;
+ 
+ impl NetworkIsolation {
+     /// Block all network access for a sandbox
+     #[cfg(target_os = &quot;windows&quot;)]
+     pub fn block_all_network_access(sandbox_id: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let ps_script = format!(
+             r#&quot;New-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName &quot;Codex Sandbox Block {sandbox_id}&quot; -Direction Outbound -Action Block -Program &quot;C:\CodexSandbox\{sandbox_id}\*&quot;&quot;#
+         );
+ 
+         Command::new(&quot;powershell.exe&quot;)
+             .arg(&quot;-Command&quot;)
+             .arg(&amp;ps_script)
+             .output()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to create firewall rule&quot;)?;
+ 
+         tracing::info!(&quot;Network access blocked for sandbox {sandbox_id}&quot;);
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     #[cfg(not(target_os = &quot;windows&quot;))]
+     pub fn block_all_network_access(_sandbox_id: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         anyhow::bail!(&quot;Network isolation only supported on Windows&quot;)
